comments:
Using source from evening of 6/7/06:

1) Create new JSF Project.  Ensure one component library is selected and deployed.

2) Undeploy the library from JSF Library Reference project properties.

Get UnhandledEventLoopException:
Caused by: org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed: ContentViewer must have a content provider when input is set.
	at org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:182)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ContentViewer.setInput(ContentViewer.java:242)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.setInput(StructuredViewer.java:1542)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.jsflibraryconfig.JSFLibraryConfigControl.loadJSFImplList(JSFLibraryConfigControl.java:188)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.jsflibraryconfig.JSFLibraryConfigControl.initializeControlValues(JSFLibraryConfigControl.java:160)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.jsflibraryconfig.JSFLibraryConfigControl.access$11(JSFLibraryConfigControl.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.ui.internal.jsflibraryconfig.JSFLibraryConfigControl$10.run(JSFLibraryConfigControl.java:741)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123)
	... 20 more

This bug was introduced by a fix for 145895. 
Since the fix for bug 145895 has been removed, this bug is invalid.

traces.message: Assertion failed: ContentViewer must have a content provider when input is set.
